terms.definition: A systematic process of ensuring that products and services meet specified requirements and regulatory standards through documentation, testing, and compliance monitoring.
Standard Operating Procedure - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks consistently and in compliance with regulations.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents over time, maintaining a history of revisions and ensuring teams work with the most current version.
Corrective and Preventive Actions - systematic processes used to investigate, address, and prevent quality issues or deviations from established procedures.
Good Manufacturing Practice - a set of regulations and guidelines that ensure pharmaceutical and biotech products are consistently produced to quality standards.
A security method that restricts document access and editing permissions based on a user's role or position within an organization.
A collaborative feature that allows multiple team members to simultaneously edit and review the same document in real-time.
The process of ensuring that business operations, products, and documentation adhere to laws, regulations, and industry standards set by governing bodies.
A formal process for managing and documenting modifications to procedures, systems, or products to ensure they maintain compliance and quality standards.
The documented process of demonstrating that a system, process, or method consistently produces results that meet predetermined specifications and quality attributes.
Food and Drug Administration - the U.S. federal agency responsible for regulating and supervising the safety of drugs, medical devices, and biotechnology products.
The process of quickly locating and accessing specific documents from a centralized storage system, often critical during audits and inspections.
A chronological record of document changes, user actions, and system events that provides accountability and supports regulatory compliance.
The practice of teams from different departments working together on shared documentation and processes to ensure consistency and compliance.
European Medicines Agency - the regulatory body responsible for the evaluation and supervision of medicinal products in the European Union.
